What book is The movie The Great Mouse Detective based on?

The movieThe Great Mouse Detective is based on the bookBasil of Baker Streetwritten by  Eve Titus

Basil of Baker StreetPublished by Simon and Schuster - 5/17/2016

A mouse who lives in Sherlock Holmes' cellar evolves a daring plan to uncover the identity of a kidnapper.

The Great Mouse Detective Mastermind Collection Books 1-8

written byEve TitusandCathy Hapka

Published by Aladdin - 6/16/2020

Join Basil, the Sherlock Holmes of the mouse world—and the inspiration for the hit Disney film The Great Mouse Detective—as he solves some of his most thrilling cases in this entertaining boxed set! Basil—the detective mastermind of the mouse world—lives in the cellar of Sherlock Holmes’s house. A devoted admirer of the great detective, he has learned his craft by listening at the feet of Holmes himself. Join Basil and his friend, Dr. Dawson, they solve some of their most baffling cases in this collectible boxed set! The paperback boxed set includes: Basil of Baker Street Basil and the Cave of Cats Basil in Mexico Basil in the Wild West Basil and the Lost Colony Basil and the Big Cheese Cook-Off Basil and the Royal Dare Basil and the Library Ghost

Basil and the Cave of Cats

written byEve Titus

Published by Simon and Schuster - 5/17/2016

The mouse who lives in Sherlock Holmes' cellar heads to the lost island of Kataarh to unravel the mystery of a race of miniature cats and their mouse king.

Basil in Mexico

written byEve Titus

Published by Simon and Schuster - 10/4/2016

Basil, mouse and master detective seeking the truth behind the theft of the Mousa Lisa, must also solve the mystery of his companion's disappearance.

Did you know that the movie The Great Mouse Detective is based on the book Basil of Baker Street?

In Victorian London, England, a little mouse girl's toymaker father is abducted by a peglegged bat. She enlists the aid of Basil of Baker Street, the rodent world's answer to Sherlock Holmes. The case expands as Basil uncovers the crime's link to a plot against the Crown itself.

  • Internet Movie Database:  7.2/10
  • Rotten Tomatoes:  80%
  • Metacritic:  73/100
